meanings.definition: To buy goods and sell them again at a higher price.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys regrating vintage items for a profit.
meanings.sent2: The store owner is regrating the imported goods to make a profit.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox was caught regrating the farmer's produce.
meanings.sent4: His business strategy involves regrating products to maximize earnings.
meanings.sent5: The art of regrating requires a keen eye for market trends.

meanings.definition: The act of buying goods and selling them again at a higher price.
meanings.sent1: The regrating of antiques is a common practice in this market.
meanings.sent2: She made a profit through the regrating of luxury handbags.
meanings.sent3: The regrating of rare books can be quite lucrative.
meanings.sent4: His success in regrating electronics is well-known in the industry.
meanings.sent5: The art of regrating involves understanding customer preferences.
